solution_line_template: If on a tough week she sells half what she sells on a good week, then on a good week she sells {tough_week_sales}*{half_multiplier} = <<{tough_week_sales}*{half_multiplier}={good_week_sales}>>{good_week_sales} dollars.
If she had {num_good_weeks} good weeks, the amount is {num_good_weeks}*{good_week_sales} = <<{num_good_weeks}*{good_week_sales}={total_good_weeks_sales}>>{total_good_weeks_sales} dollars.
During the {num_tough_weeks} tough weeks, she sells {num_tough_weeks}*{tough_week_sales} = <<{num_tough_weeks}*{tough_week_sales}={total_tough_weeks_sales}>>{total_tough_weeks_sales} dollars.
The total amount she sold in both weeks is {total_tough_weeks_sales}+{total_good_weeks_sales} = <<{total_tough_weeks_sales}+{total_good_weeks_sales}={total_sales}>>{total_sales} dollars.
